intro: Oreogrammitis habbemensis, commonly known as the Habbemnes moss, is a rare and specialized liverwort species native to specific regions in northern Africa. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocky substrates or in mountainous areas with high humidity. The plant has a distinctive morphology, characterized by its compact growth form and intricate leaf arrangement. Its reproductive structures are well-developed, contributing to its ability to propagate in suitable microhabitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Oreogrammitis habbemensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research.
